We investigate the effect of an initial transformation defined by \\( f(z) = e^{i\\theta}z \\), where \\( \\theta \\) is a constant real number.

If \\( f(z) \\) is applied to a vector \\( z_0 \\) at t = 0, and the system evolves under the given differential equations without further intervention, will \\( z(t) \\) at t = T be the same as if \\( z_0 \\) evolved directly under the given differential equations to t = T?
Explanation: The application of \\( f(z) \\) modifies the initial state by rotating the complex plane, which affects the trajectory of both \\( u(t) \\) and \\( v(t) \\). As a result, the dynamics of the system are altered, producing a different outcome at time T.
